data.question: What is the chemical formula of the tetrazolate- and cyano-bridged homometallic mixed-valence copper(I,II) molecular ferrimagnet reported?
What unusual behavior does the molecule [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n exhibit under a magnetic field?
data.answer: It exhibits a field-induced transition from a 3D antiferromagnetic state to a ferrimagnetic state.

data.question: What is the role of cyanide in the synthesis of [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n?
data.answer: Cyanide is generated in situ by metal-assisted cleavage of S–C or C–C bonds and acts as a ligand.

data.question: True or False: Monovalent CuI is paramagnetic.
What is the coordination geometry of Cu(1) in the compound [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n?
True or False: The compound [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n is based on a 1D superexchange network.
What is the Weiss constant of the compound [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n?
What is the significance of the temperature 7.9 K for the compound [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n?
data.answer: It is the temperature at which a very high and sharp maximum in magnetic susceptibility is observed, characteristic of ferrimagnetism.

data.question: True or False: The compound [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n shows a frequency-dependent maximum in ac susceptibilities.
What is the result of increasing the applied magnetic field above 1400 Oe for the compound [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n?
data.answer: The adjacent ferrimagnetic chains are arranged in a parallel fashion to give a 3D ferrimagnet.

data.question: True or False: The compound [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n exhibits magnetic hysteresis loops at 20 K.
What is the role of the tta-B groups in the structure of [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n?
data.answer: The tta-B groups pillar the 2D sheets to complete the 3D framework.

data.question: True or False: The saturation magnetization at 70,000 Oe for [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n indicates that all spins carrying CuII ions are uncompensated.
What is the primary synthetic challenge in creating homospin homometallic ferrimagnetic systems?
data.answer: Achieving conditions for noncompensation of individual spin moments.

data.question: True or False: The compound [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n is a 2D mixed-valence copper(I,II) compound.
What is the yield of the black crystals of [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n obtained from the solvothermal reaction?
True or False: The coordination geometries of Cu(1) and Cu(2) in [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n do not confirm the strong Jahn–Teller effect.
What is the effect of a minor impurity on the magnetic ordering of [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n?
data.answer: It affects magnetic ordering at 16 K and contributes to unusual phenomena such as bifurcation in ZFC–FC curves.

data.question: What is the temperature range in which magnetic hysteresis loops are observed for [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n?
True or False: The compound [Cu5(tta)6(CN)2]n is a homospin homometallic molecular ferrimagnet based on a 3D superexchange network.
